title: Open Mic Night at The Comedy Attic
location: The Comedy Attic,123 S Walnut St, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Every Wednesday at 8PM is Comedy Attic Open Mic Night. Bloomington has one of the best local comedy scenes in the country, and it all starts with our open mic night!

Each comedian is asked to do no more than five minutes of completely original material. While we do not care about foul language in your set, we do not allow racist, homophobic, transphobic or rape/female bashing jokes. If you have to ask if it's racist, homophobic, transphobic or a rape joke, it probably is.

Comedians that wish to participate are asked to e-mail comedyattic@gmail.com mailto:comedyattic@gmail.com . Newcomers and any participants who are not paid professionals will be required to bring audience members to see them. This is non-negotiable. So if you plan on signing up, be sure to invite as many friends as you can. Good luck!

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: New Music Ensemble – David Dzubay, director; Emma Cardon-Wake, composer
description:
Repertoire  Julia Wolfe: Tell me everything (1994)Yuting Tan: Amnesia (2023)Emma Cardon-Wake: GIRLHOOD (2025, premiere)*  *Georgina Joshi Composition CommissionAbout the ConductorDavid Dzubay's compositions have been performed in the United States, Europe, Canada, Mexico, and Asia by the symphony orchestras of Aspen, Atlanta, Baltimore, Boston, Cincinnati, Detroit, Fort Wayne, Guangxi, Guiyang, Honolulu, Kansas City, Louisville, Memphis, Minnesota, Oregon, Oakland, St. Louis and Vancouver; the American Composers Orchestra, National Symphonies of Ireland and Mexico, New World Symphony, National Repertory Orchestra, and New York Youth Symphony; and ensembles including the Grossman Ensemble, Le Nouvel Ensemble Moderne, Onix, Manhattan and St. Louis Brass Quintets, Voices of Change, the Alexander, Orion and Pacifica string quartets, the League/ISCM, Earplay, and the San Francisco Contemporary Music Players. His music has been championed by conductors including James DePreist, George Hanson, Keith Lockhart, David Loebel, Michael Morgan, Eiji Oue, Richard Pittman, Iván del Prado, Mark Russell Smith, Lawrence Leighton Smith, Michael Stern, Carl Topilow, David Wiley, Kirk Trevor, Thomas Wilkins, and David Zinman. Honors include two Fromm Music Foundation commissions; Guggenheim, MacDowell, Yaddo, Copland House, and Djerassi fellowships; the Kuhmo Chamber Music Festival Composition Competition, Indianapolis Chamber Orchestra Composition Competition, Utah Arts Festival Commission, William Revelli and Walter Beeler Memorial Prizes, Wayne Peterson Prize; and grants from the Aaron Copland Fund for Music for two portrait CDs. Currently professor of music and director of the New Music Ensemble at the Indiana University Jacobs School of Music in Bloomington, Dzubay was previously on the faculty of the University of North Texas in Denton. Since 2011, he has taught composition for three weeks each summer at the Brevard Music Center. From 1995 to 1998, he served as composer-consultant to the Minnesota Orchestra and during the 2005-06 season, he was Meet the Composer/American Symphony Orchestra League Music Alive Composer-in-Residence with the Green Bay Symphony Orchestra. Dzubay has conducted at the Tanglewood, Aspen, and June in Buffalo festivals as well as the National Symphony of Columbia, Grossman Ensemble, League of Composers Orchestra, Pittsburgh New Music Ensemble, Music from China, and Voices of Change.The Georgina Joshi Composition Commission Award  A vision of Louise Addicott-Joshi and made possible by a gift from The Georgina Joshi Foundation, the annual Georgina Joshi Composition Commission is awarded to a student composer in support of a new work for solo voice and instrumental ensemble to be premiered and recorded by the New Music Ensemble. The award is presented in conjunction with the Composition Department's annual Dean's Prizes.Georgina Joshi earned her bachelor's degree in music (with honors) from the Royal College of Music in London and pursued a master's degree in the Jacobs School of Music. While at IU, Joshi appeared as a soloist in major choral performances and IU Opera Theater productions. An enthusiastic performer, she was featured in a variety of regional ensembles and festivals, and appeared as a soloist in England, Wales, Romania, and Greece.

Source: IU Jacobs School of Music

title: Tour of Thomas Hart Benton's Indiana Murals
location: AUDITORIUM - Room Number: Hall of Murals
description:
This tour visitsThe Hall of Murals at IU Auditorium  IU Cinema  Woodburn Hall  About the Indiana Murals:  Thomas Hart Benton was commissioned to paint murals depicting Indiana history for the Indiana state pavilion at the 1933 World's Fair in Chicago. The dramatic 250-foot long mural, which originally wrapped around the entire exhibition hall at the World's Fair, depicts the social, economic, and cultural history of Indiana from mound building to the 1930s. After several years of storage following the fair, the panels were given to Indiana University in 1938, where they were installed in three locations on the Bloomington campus. About Your Guide:  Jim Davis is a Senior Lecturer in the Kelley School of Business, in the department of Management and Entrepreneurship. He has been serving as a docent and museum guide at the IU Eskenazi Museum of Art for the past ten years.     Know Before You GoThis tour visits three locations on campus. Please let us know if an elevator and wheelchair accessible route will be needed.   Plan to arrive at least 5 minutes beforehand to check in.For a discounted parking rate for the Indiana Memorial Union parking lot, visit the Eskenazi Museum of Art before or after this tour and ask Guest Services, at the Information Desk on the first floor, to stamp your parking voucher.

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

title: Finn: A New Musical- At the PB&J Cafe
location: Waldron Auditorium,122 South Walnut Street, Bloomington, IN 47404, USA
description:
Constellation Stage & Screen presents “Finn: A New Musical- At the PB&J Cafe,” on stage May 1-17 at the Waldron Auditorium.

From the creator of Doc McStuffins and Vampirina, Finn is a heartwarming musical adventure about a young shark on the brink of growing up. As he prepares to join the fearsome Shark Guard, Finn can’t shake the feeling that he’s different from the other sharks. Deep inside, he discovers a colorful fish inside him—a part of himself that longs to sparkle, sing, and dance. As Finn embarks on a journey of self-discovery, friendship, and adventure, he finds the courage to be himself! Fun for all ages!

PB&J Cafe: A Dinner Theater for Kids! At the PB&J Cafe, young theatergoers will enjoy a meal during the performance and leave with autographs from their favorite characters.


See Constellation’s website for more information, including a detailed performance schedule. Learn more and find tickets at seeconstellation.org/kids/finn/ https://seeconstellation.org/kids/finn/ https://seeconstellation.org/kids/finn/

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Writing in the Galleries
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART - Room Number: Check in on the first floor
description:
In this workshop, we begin by looking closely at artwork—asking what we see, think, feel, and wonder. Together, we'll explore the artist's possible message and its social meaning, then turn those reflections into our own creative responses.  Whether you're a writer or simply curious to try something new, you'll find inspiration here and a welcoming community to share the journey.  What to Bringyour favorite pencil (no pens).  a notebook or paper. Clipboards are available to borrow.  a phone or camera to take a picture of the art for later reference.  Know Before You GoArrive early, check in, and get ready for an on-time start.Readwhere to find us, where to park, accessibility, and museum guidelines.About Your Facilitator  Dedaimia Whitney earned an MFA in fiction from Indiana University under the direction of Scott Russell Sanders. She taught creative writing at Franklin College for many years. She has served the museum as a docent since 2019. Her favorite works of art are those that are both visually stimulating and thought-provoking.

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

If this page says, "Registration has closed" that means the waitlist is full.SuppliesBring your favorite drawing pencil (e.g. 4B), a sketchbook or drawing paper, and a phone or device to photograph artwork (without flash) as we sketch.  Know Before You GoArrive early to find parking, check in, and get your drawing supplies ready.  At 1:55 p.m. any unclaimed reservations will be released to guests who are standing by waiting for a spot.  Where to find us, where to park, accessibility, and museum guidelines (https://artmuseum.indiana.edu/visit/your-visit.html).  This workshop is recommended for ages 12 and up. Anyone under 18, who is not an IU student, must be accompanied by an adult.  When You ArriveCheck in with Guest Services at the information desk on the first floor, even if you come often and even if you are late. We appreciate having an accurate attendance count.  Store all backpacks and large bags before entering the galleries. A small handbag may be carried at your side.  Get your supplies ready. Attach an 18x24" piece of newsprint to a drawing board.  Cancellations  This workshop often has a waitlist. Please use the cancellation link included with your confirmation email if your plans change.About the Instructor  John Cheek has taught credit and non-credit classes for eight years in portrait painting, landscape painting, palette knife painting, life drawing, beginning drawing, and advanced drawing, as well as in design. He volunteers his time and expertise to facilitate drawing workshops at the Eskenazi Museum of Art.

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

From the creator of Doc McStuffins and Vampirina, Finn is a heartwarming musical adventure about a young shark on the brink of growing up. As he prepares to join the fearsome Shark Guard, Finn can’t shake the feeling that he’s different from the other sharks. Deep inside, he discovers a colorful fish inside him—a part of himself that longs to sparkle, sing, and dance. As Finn embarks on a journey of self-discovery, friendship, and adventure, he finds the courage to be himself! Fun for all ages!

title: Family Art Lab
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART - Room Number: Roehm Family Art-making Studio
description:
Please note that this month's Family Art Lab does not follow the second Sunday schedule.  Designed for K-12 students and their families, this event offers a fun and flexible way to spark creativity and connect with each other. All ages and experience levels are welcome!  Come and go at your own pace. We recommend planning for at least an hour to explore the gallery and make art.  Start in the Art Studio inside the Kimberly and John Simpson Center for Education on the museum's 2nd floor to pick up your Gallery Challenge. Then head to the galleries to find the artwork we'll use as inspiration for our project! When you're ready, head back to the studio for our hands-on art-making activity that everyone will love.  This program takes place every Second Sunday of the month, excluding holidays and museum closures. Each month features new artworks and materials, so there's always something fresh to explore and create!  All children must be chaperoned.Know Before You Go:Read about where to find us, where to park, accessibility, and museum guidelines.Strollers are welcome in the galleries. When carrying small children, please keep them in front of you.  To save time at the lockers, avoid bringing backpacks or large bags.  When You Arrive:If you parked in the IMU parking lot, Guest Services can validate your parking voucher for a discount.  Store any large bags in the lockers behind the Guest Services desk.  Head upstairs to the 2nd Floor and into the Simpson Center for Education to start.  When in the galleries, do not touch the artwork. Be mindful to keep body parts and anything you're carrying at least 18" away from the art.  Photography is welcome! Just no flash or selfie sticks.

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

title: Open Mic Night at The Comedy Attic
location: The Comedy Attic,123 S Walnut St, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Every Wednesday at 8PM is Comedy Attic Open Mic Night. Bloomington has one of the best local comedy scenes in the country, and it all starts with our open mic night!

Each comedian is asked to do no more than five minutes of completely original material. While we do not care about foul language in your set, we do not allow racist, homophobic, transphobic or rape/female bashing jokes. If you have to ask if it's racist, homophobic, transphobic or a rape joke, it probably is.

Comedians that wish to participate are asked to e-mail comedyattic@gmail.com mailto:comedyattic@gmail.com . Newcomers and any participants who are not paid professionals will be required to bring audience members to see them. This is non-negotiable. So if you plan on signing up, be sure to invite as many friends as you can. Good luck!

title: Homeschool Day: America 250
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART
description:
Travel back in time with us to America in 1776 to meet George Washington and see the Declaration of Independence up close. Together, we'll explore the art and stories that shaped our nation's founding. Afterwards, we'll create our own colonial-inspired artwork in the studio, reflecting on the theme of "What America Means to Me."Know Before You Go:  Meet us on the 1st floor of the museum at 10 a.m. Together, we'll drop off personal items in the Simpson Center for Education before exploring the galleries. After seeing artworks that will inspire our project, we'll head back to the Roehm Family Art-Making Studio to create our own masterpieces! Don't forget to dress for a mess!  Strollers are welcome. Chaperones required. We ask that chaperones be 18 or older, with one adult for every 6 children.Parking Information:  The museum is in the pedestrian district of campus with several parking options nearby. The Indiana Memorial Union lot (900 E. 7th Street) is just a 5-minute walk diagonal to the museum, and visitors can receive 40% off parking validation at the museum's guest services desk. The East Garage (105 N. Eagleson Ave.) and Fee Lane Garage (709 N. Fee Lane) are also convenient, about an 8–10 minute walk. Learn more about parking on the Bloomington campus here (https://parking.indiana.edu/facilities/index.html).

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

title: Finn: A New Musical- At the PB&J Cafe
location: Waldron Auditorium,122 South Walnut Street, Bloomington, IN 47404, USA
description:
Constellation Stage & Screen presents “Finn: A New Musical- At the PB&J Cafe,” on stage May 1-17 at the Waldron Auditorium.

From the creator of Doc McStuffins and Vampirina, Finn is a heartwarming musical adventure about a young shark on the brink of growing up. As he prepares to join the fearsome Shark Guard, Finn can’t shake the feeling that he’s different from the other sharks. Deep inside, he discovers a colorful fish inside him—a part of himself that longs to sparkle, sing, and dance. As Finn embarks on a journey of self-discovery, friendship, and adventure, he finds the courage to be himself! Fun for all ages!

PB&J Cafe: A Dinner Theater for Kids! At the PB&J Cafe, young theatergoers will enjoy a meal during the performance and leave with autographs from their favorite characters.


See Constellation’s website for more information, including a detailed performance schedule. Learn more and find tickets at seeconstellation.org/kids/finn/ https://seeconstellation.org/kids/finn/ https://seeconstellation.org/kids/finn/

Constellation offers select sensory-friendly performances for our Constellation for Kids series. This special performance is designed to create a theater experience that is welcoming to all families with children with sensory sensitivities. Tickets to Constellation’s sensory-friendly performances are Pay What You Will https://seeconstellation.org/box-office/pwyw/ , meaning you get to choose your own ticket price (starting at $10, plus a $3 venue preservation fee). Sponsored by Unlocking the Spectrum https://unlockingthespectrum.com/ .

title: Whose Live Anyway?
location: Buskirk-Chumley Theater,114 East Kirkwood Avenue, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
WHOSE LIVE ANYWAY?

The current cast members of the Emmy-nominated TV show Whose Line Is It Anyway? are proud to present their new improv tour: WHOSE LIVE ANYWAY?

WHOSE LIVE ANYWAY? is 90 minutes of hilarious improvised comedy and song all based on audience suggestions. Cast members Ryan Stiles, Greg Proops, Jeff B. Davis, and Joel Murray will leave you gasping with the very witty scenes they invent before your eyes. Audience participation is key to the show so bring your suggestions and you might be asked to join the cast onstage! WHOSE LIVE ANYWAY? showcases some of the improv games made famous on the long-running TV show as well as some exciting new ones, featuring musical direction by Laura Hall.

All ages are welcomed, but please note that some “PG-13” language will be used during the performance.

title: Open Mic Night at The Comedy Attic
location: The Comedy Attic,123 S Walnut St, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Every Wednesday at 8PM is Comedy Attic Open Mic Night. Bloomington has one of the best local comedy scenes in the country, and it all starts with our open mic night!

Each comedian is asked to do no more than five minutes of completely original material. While we do not care about foul language in your set, we do not allow racist, homophobic, transphobic or rape/female bashing jokes. If you have to ask if it's racist, homophobic, transphobic or a rape joke, it probably is.

Comedians that wish to participate are asked to e-mail comedyattic@gmail.com mailto:comedyattic@gmail.com . Newcomers and any participants who are not paid professionals will be required to bring audience members to see them. This is non-negotiable. So if you plan on signing up, be sure to invite as many friends as you can. Good luck!

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Belt Out Loud! - Featuring Cody Ikerd and the Sidewinders
location: Buskirk-Chumley Theater,114 East Kirkwood Avenue, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Stone Belt is proud to announce The Sixth Annual Belt Out Loud! concert, at 7pm on May 30th. This year’s headlining performers are country music stars Cody Ikerd and the Sidewinders, whose heartfelt songs and captivating stage presence promise an unforgettable evening.


Attendees can enjoy a night of incredible music while supporting a great cause. Belt Out Loud serves as a model for future events aiming to promote accessibility and inclusion for individuals of all abilities, ensuring an enjoyable experience for everyone. By supporting Belt Out Loud, attendees are advocating for a more inclusive society and promoting awareness about the importance of accessibility. Together, we’ll enjoy a night of music and pave the way for a future where every event, big or small, embraces inclusivity as it’s core value.


The proceeds from the event will help Stone Belt provide vital services to individuals with developmental disabilities in our community, including employment training, day and residential services, and advocacy support. So come out and enjoy a fantastic concert while making a positive impact!


This event is proudly sponsored by IU Credit Union, Old National Bank, Office Easel, Tri-County Hydraullics, Resource Services, and Visit Bloomington.


The proceeds from your ticket will help Stone Belt provide vital services to individuals with developmental disabilities in our community, including employment training, day and residential services, and advocacy support. So come out and enjoy a fantastic concert while making a positive impact!

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Parents' Afternoon In at the Eskenazi Museum of Art
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART
description:
Parents' Afternoon In offers a unique opportunity to enjoy the museum with separate parallel programming that supports creativity, and relaxation. Kids will have the opportunity to engage with art while parents relax with a variety of activities.  K-12 Children's Program12:00–12:30 PM: Guided gallery exploration.  12:30–2:00 PM: Hands-on art activity in the art studio + snack.  Adult Program12:00–1:00 PM: Experience select galleries through a fun and casual guided experience.  1:00–2:00 PM: Choose your own adventure: relax with art-filled coloring sheets, have a snack from the museum cafe or explore more of the galleries at your leisure.

title: Another Revolution
location: Constellation Playhouse,107 West 9th Street, Bloomington, IN 47404, USA
description:
Constellation Stage & Screen presents “Another Revolution,” on stage June 4-21 at the Constellation Playhouse.

Some revolutions happen in the streets. Others in the lab.

Kat and Henry, two graduate students from opposing scientific disciplines, are forced to share a lab at Columbia University in 1968. Amidst interpersonal differences, a campus devolving into political chaos, and the uncertainty and turmoil of the outside world, they each discover what it’s like to be thrown into someone else’s orbit. By Jacqueline Bircher, playwright of Constellation’s hit production of Webster’s B!+@#. Recommended for ages 13+.


See Constellation’s website for more information, including a detailed performance schedule. Learn more and find tickets at seeconstellation.org/mainstage/another-revolution/ https://seeconstellation.org/mainstage/another-revolution/ https://seeconstellation.org/mainstage/another-revolution/

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Arts Mile
description:
Experience downtown Bloomington’s vibrant Arts Mile as select galleries showcase evolving live and virtual exhibits.

EVERY. FIRST. FRIDAY. Experience an exciting night of the arts as fourteen distinct galleries stay open late to host special exhibits and serve refreshments from 5-8pm.

Stroll the vibrant arts scene along the sensational art mile and experience amazing art by renowned local, regional, and international artists. Discover delightful surprises, inspiration, festivities, and original works of art for purchase. Explore each distinctive gallery in-person or online all year long at your own pace.

Click here to learn more https://www.gallerywalkbloomington.com/

title: Lemonade Day 2026
description:
Lemonade Day is a free, fun, experiential learning program that teaches youth how to start, own and operate their own business – a lemonade stand. 
The foremost objective of Lemonade Day is to empower youth to take ownership of their lives and become productive members of society – the business leaders, social advocates, volunteers, and forward thinking citizens of tomorrow. 
Each child that registers receives access to Lemonopolis, our FREE and FUN online curriculum that teaches them Lemonade Day lessons like creating budgets, setting profit-making goals, serving customers, repaying investors, and giving back to the community. Along the way, they acquire skills in goal-setting, problem solving, and gain self-esteem critical for future success. They also receive additional digital content from local sponsors and experts on topics like Building a Lemonade Stand, Recipe Exploration, Marketing, and more!

Source: Boys & Girls Club Bloomington

title: Writing in the Galleries
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART - Room Number: Check in on the first floor
description:
In this workshop, we begin by looking closely at artwork—asking what we see, think, feel, and wonder. Together, we'll explore what we think the artist is trying to say and what the social significance of their message might be. Then we'll use our imaginations to respond to any aspect of our experience. Poets, story-tellers, and essayists are all welcome in this group!  What to Bringyour favorite pencil (no pens).  a notebook or paper. Clipboards are available to borrow.  a phone or camera to take a picture of the art for later reference.  Know Before You GoArrive early, check in, and get ready for an on-time start.Readwhere to find us, where to park, accessibility, and museum guidelines.About Your Facilitator  Dedaimia Whitney earned an MFA in fiction from Indiana University under the direction of Scott Russell Sanders. She taught creative writing at Franklin College for many years. She has served the museum as a docent since 2019. Her favorite works of art are those that are both visually stimulating and thought-provoking.

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

title: Color Drawing and Painting Workshop
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART - Room Number: Check in with Guest Services on the first floor
description:
Discover the joy of drawing in an inspiring setting! Begin by sketching directly from artwork in the collection to sharpen your eye and strengthen your skills. Then, move into the studio to learn about color theory and add color to your artwork.Strengthen fundamental drawing skills  Explore color theory in action  Experiment with color media  Expand your creative expression in a hands-on way  Reserve your spot. If this page says, "Registration has closed" that means the waitlist is full.SuppliesBring your favorite drawing pencil (e.g. 4B), a sketchbook or drawing paper, and a phone or device to photograph artwork (without flash) as we sketch. Additional supplies are provided.  Know Before You GoArrive early to find parking, check in, and get your drawing supplies ready.  At 1:55 p.m. any unclaimed reservations will be released to guests who are standing by waiting for a spot.  Where to find us, where to park, accessibility, and museum guidelines (https://artmuseum.indiana.edu/visit/your-visit.html).  This workshop is recommended for ages 12 and up. Anyone under 18, who is not an IU student, must be accompanied by an adult.  When You ArriveCheck in with Guest Services at the information desk on the first floor, even if you come often and even if you are late. We appreciate having an accurate attendance count.  Store all backpacks and large bags before entering the galleries. A small handbag may be carried at your side.  Get your supplies ready. Attach an 18x24" piece of newsprint to a drawing board.  Cancellations  This workshop often has a waitlist. Please use the cancellation link included with your confirmation email if your plans change.About the Instructor  John Cheek has taught credit and non-credit classes for eight years in portrait painting, landscape painting, palette knife painting, life drawing, beginning drawing, and advanced drawing, as well as in design. title: Relaxing with Landscapes
location: SIDNEY AND LOIS ESKENAZI MUSEUM OF ART - Room Number: check in with Guest Services at the information desk on the first floor
description:
Cool down your body while heating up your mind as we discuss what we see as a group, helping each other discover details we might otherwise miss in a quick visit through the galleries.    About Your Guide  Dr. TammyJo Eckhart is an ancient historian who has enjoyed being part of the Eskenazi Guide Program since 2009. She was the 2025 recipient of the Patricia and Joel Meier Guide Award from that program. She looks forward to sitting with you and really spending time with these wonderful landscapes.    Know Before You Go  Space is available for the first 12 people to check in with Guest Services on the day. Drop by the information desk on the first floor of the museum when you arrive.A small handbag may be carried at your side. Backpacks and large bags will need to be stored before touring. Learn more aboutmuseum guidelines.If you park in the IMU parking lot, Guest Services can validate your parking voucher for a discount.Read aboutwhere to find us and where to park,

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

title: Arts Mile
description:
Experience downtown Bloomington’s vibrant Arts Mile as select galleries showcase evolving live and virtual exhibits.

EVERY. FIRST. FRIDAY. Experience an exciting night of the arts as fourteen distinct galleries stay open late to host special exhibits and serve refreshments from 5-8pm.

Stroll the vibrant arts scene along the sensational art mile and experience amazing art by renowned local, regional, and international artists. Discover delightful surprises, inspiration, festivities, and original works of art for purchase. Explore each distinctive gallery in-person or online all year long at your own pace.

title: Zach Rushing “Redneck Logic” Comedy Tour
location: Buskirk-Chumley Theater,114 East Kirkwood Avenue, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
I’m just a Mississippi boy with a loud mouth and a big heart. I grew up believing in hard work, good friends, and telling it like it is, and I never really grew out of that. Most people know me from my comedy, where I’ve built a career on being unapologetically myself. Whether I’m on stage for the Not-So-Rich-And-Famous Tour, raising hell on social media, or telling stories that hit a little too close to home, I try to keep it real and keep people laughing.

But I’m more than just a comic. I run Triple B Outdoors, where I get to share my love for hunting, fishing, and the outdoors with folks who live for the same things I do. I’m engaged to the love of my life, and when I’m not on the road, you’ll find me in the woods, on the water, or working to grow my businesses.

At the end of the day, I’m not trying to be famous, I’m just trying to be honest, entertain people, and maybe inspire a few along the way. If you stick around, you’ll get jokes, a little wisdom, and probably a few stories you wouldn’t want your grandma to hear.

This is an 18+ event.

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Teen Pancake Breakfast
description:
Our Teen Programs are hosting our annual Pancake Breakfast, coming up in just a few weeks! The breakfast will be on Saturday July 26th at BJ’s Brewhouse located at 411 S. College Mall Road. The event will be from 8:00-10:00 am. And the best part?? It’s only $5 per ticket!! And that $5 goes towards supporting our teens! 
Our Pancake Breakfast is way more than just a simple breakfast–this innovative program teaches Club Teens how to take responsibility for THEIR teen program by raising money. It also teaches them sales, customer service, confidence and teamwork!
Tickets are available at our Lincoln Street, Ellettsville, & Ferguson Crestmont Clubs for only $5

Step into the world of acclaimed photographer Rania Matar (b. 1964, Lebanon), whose striking portraits document young women persisting in uncertain times. Matar's lens highlights women's creativity, strength, dignity, and resilience—offering a powerful counter-narrative to the challenges of her country and region. Read more about this featured exhibition (https://artmuseum.indiana.edu/exhibitions/upcoming/_feature-exhibitions/2026-03-05-rania-matar-where-do-i-go.html).  Join us for a rare opportunity to explore the artist's work in depth, guided by the scholar who researched and curated the exhibition. Read Leila Reichert's bio. (http://Elliot%20Josephine%20Leila%20Reichert%20is%20an%20American%20curator,%20critic,%20and%20editor.%20She%20is%20the%20inaugural%20Curator%20of%20Contemporary%20Art%20at%20the%20Eskenazi%20Museum%20of%20Art%20at%20Indiana%20University%20and%20was%20a%202023-24%20Propel%20Fellow%20with%20the%20Association%20of%20Art%20Museum%20Curators%20Foundation.%20She%20was%20formerly%20Art%20Editor%20of%20Newcity%20and%20Assistant%20Curator%20at%20the%20Block%20Museum%20of%20Art,%20Northwestern%20University.%20She%20has%20curated%20and%20assisted%20in%20developing%20critically%20celebrated%20exhibitions%20in%20the%20United%20States%20and%20abroad.%20Her%20critical%20writing%20has%20been%20published%20in%20the%20Journal%20of%20Visual%20Studies,%20Hyperallergic,%20the%20Brooklyn%20Rail,%20Newcity%20Art,%20and%20The%20Seen,%20among%20others.%20She%20holds%20dual%20masters%E2%80%99%20degrees%20in%20Modern%20and%20Contemporary%20Art%20History%20and%20Arts%20Administration%20and%20Cultural%20Policy%20from%20the%20School%20of%20the%20Art%20Institute%20of%20Chicago%20and%20a%20Bachelors%20of%20Arts%20with%20Honors%20in%20Art%20History%20from%20Northwestern%20University,%20where%20she%20graduated%20summa%20cum%20laude.)  Reserve your spot today for a chance to connect with Rania Matar's striking photographs in a personal, meaningful way. Leila will share the stories, research, and insights behind the exhibition, making this experience as memorable as the photography itself.Know Before You GoSpace is limited to 15 participants. RSVP to reserve a space. Walk-ins are welcome if space is available. If this page says "registration has closed", this means that registration and the waitlist have filled for this date and time.Plan to arrive early to check in. At 1:25 p.m., any unclaimed spaces may be released to guests who are standing by waiting for a space.Admission and tours are free.A small handbag may be carried at your side. Larger bags and backpacks will need to be stored before touring.Read about where to find us, where to park, accessibility, and museum guidelines.When You ArriveCheck in with Guest Services staff on the first floor.If you park in the IMU parking lot, Guest Services can validate your parking voucher for a discount.Be sure to store backpacks and large bags before touring. Lockers and coat racks are available.Keep space (18") between yourself, including anything you're carrying, and the art.

Source: Eskenazi Museum of Art

title: Open Mic Night at The Comedy Attic
location: The Comedy Attic,123 S Walnut St, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Every Wednesday at 8PM is Comedy Attic Open Mic Night. Bloomington has one of the best local comedy scenes in the country, and it all starts with our open mic night!

Each comedian is asked to do no more than five minutes of completely original material. While we do not care about foul language in your set, we do not allow racist, homophobic, transphobic or rape/female bashing jokes. If you have to ask if it's racist, homophobic, transphobic or a rape joke, it probably is.

Comedians that wish to participate are asked to e-mail comedyattic@gmail.com mailto:comedyattic@gmail.com . Newcomers and any participants who are not paid professionals will be required to bring audience members to see them. This is non-negotiable. So if you plan on signing up, be sure to invite as many friends as you can. Good luck!

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Arts Mile
description:
Experience downtown Bloomington’s vibrant Arts Mile as select galleries showcase evolving live and virtual exhibits.

EVERY. FIRST. FRIDAY. Experience an exciting night of the arts as fourteen distinct galleries stay open late to host special exhibits and serve refreshments from 5-8pm.

Stroll the vibrant arts scene along the sensational art mile and experience amazing art by renowned local, regional, and international artists. Discover delightful surprises, inspiration, festivities, and original works of art for purchase. Explore each distinctive gallery in-person or online all year long at your own pace.

Click here to learn more https://www.gallerywalkbloomington.com/

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Tommy Emmanuel CGP - Living In The Light Tour
location: Buskirk-Chumley Theater,114 East Kirkwood Avenue, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Hailed as “one of the best acoustic guitarists in the world” by NPR’s World Cafe, Tommy Emmanuel got his start at the age of six, when he first began touring his native Australia with his family’s band. As a teenager, he earned a reputation as a highly sought after sideman and session player, and by his early twenties, Emmanuel was playing on chart-topping hits and performing with acts like Air Supply and Men at Work. Inspired in part by his hero, Chet Atkins (who would later become a friend, mentor, and collaborator), Emmanuel stepped out on his own as a solo artist in 1979, releasing the first in a string of acclaimed instrumental albums that would make him an unlikely celebrity in his home country and beyond. In the decades that followed, he would go on to headline everywhere from the Sydney Opera House to Carnegie Hall; tour with luminaries like Eric Clapton and John Denver; win a Grammy Award for Best Instrumental Arrangement; perform for a televised audience of more than two billion at the Sydney Olympics; and collaborate with a who’s who of fellow guitar greats, including Les Paul, Mark Knopfler, Joe Walsh, Richard Thompson, Jason Isbell, and Billy Strings.


Recorded in just four days, Emmanuel’s latest album, Living In The Light, stands as the most daring—and most rewarding—collection in the globetrotting fingerpicker’s remarkable catalog, fusing his pop, jazz, classical, and roots influences into a virtuosic masterwork as exhilarating as it is intimate.




Trey Hensley:


GRAMMY® winner and reigning two-time IBMA Guitar Player of the Year Trey Hensley has been called a “musical phenom” by NPR, “a guitar-slinging superhero” by Bluegrass Today, “Nashville’s hottest young player” by Acoustic Guitar magazine, and “the Swiss Army knife of roots music” by WMOT Radio’s Craig Havighurst. Hensley’s artistry has received high praise from the likes of Merle Haggard and Marty Stuart. An Eric Clapton’s Crossroads Guitar Festival invitee who has collaborated with Johnny Cash, Vince Gill, Dolly Parton, Taj Mahal and Tommy Emmanuel, Hensley is known for his other-worldly guitar playing, jaw-dropping musicianship and soulful storytelling. Having recently announced his signature guitar with Taylor Guitars, The Trey Hensley Gold Label 510e. Hensley is set to release a new album, Can’t Outrun The Blues, on March 6, 2026. The title cut has spent multiple weeks at #1 on the bluegrass charts.

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Elvis: In Person Starring Matt Stone
location: Buskirk-Chumley Theater,114 East Kirkwood Avenue, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
The GREATEST ELVIS CONCERT EXPERIENCE IN AMERICA is RETURNING to the Buskirk-Chumley Theater on August 21st!

Internationally recognized by Graceland and the Elvis Presley Estate, the show’s star, Matt Stone, performs the CLOSEST THING to the King in history! Matt brings a never-before-seen level of authenticity and attention to detail to his craft, CAPTIVATING audiences with flawless recreation of the King of Rock ’n’ Roll in his prime!

He’s not an “Elvis impersonator,” but a talented vocalist portraying the GREATEST ENTERTAINER OF ALL TIME in a theatrical production— and after seeing this ELECTRIFYING SPECTACLE, you’ll remember ELVIS THE ICON, and forget the punchline.

He has earned the approval of Elvis’ friends and family, who have said:

“When I heard [Matt]… now if I close my eyes that’s Elvis! It touched my heart. The only person I ever heard sing like that was my brother, and [Matt] was real close—SCARY— that’s how close it was.” -Billy Stanley (Elvis’ Step Brother)

“Matt is incredibly gifted & handsome, with incredible energy and sex appeal.” – Joyce Bova (Longtime Elvis Girlfriend)

He has even been heard on SiriusXM’s ELVIS RADIO!

Backed by a sensational all-star band, Matt Stone MESMERIZES fans into blue-suede bliss as they’re HYPNOTIZED into thinking Elvis is BACK IN THE BUILDING at the PEAK of his prowess!

Source: Bloomington Arts

title: Open Mic Night at The Comedy Attic
location: The Comedy Attic,123 S Walnut St, Bloomington, IN 47408, USA
description:
Every Wednesday at 8PM is Comedy Attic Open Mic Night. Bloomington has one of the best local comedy scenes in the country, and it all starts with our open mic night!

Each comedian is asked to do no more than five minutes of completely original material. While we do not care about foul language in your set, we do not allow racist, homophobic, transphobic or rape/female bashing jokes. If you have to ask if it's racist, homophobic, transphobic or a rape joke, it probably is.

Comedians that wish to participate are asked to e-mail comedyattic@gmail.com mailto:comedyattic@gmail.com . Newcomers and any participants who are not paid professionals will be required to bring audience members to see them. This is non-negotiable. So if you plan on signing up, be sure to invite as many friends as you can. Good luck!

title: Arts Mile
description:
Experience downtown Bloomington’s vibrant Arts Mile as select galleries showcase evolving live and virtual exhibits.

EVERY. FIRST. FRIDAY. Experience an exciting night of the arts as fourteen distinct galleries stay open late to host special exhibits and serve refreshments from 5-8pm.

Stroll the vibrant arts scene along the sensational art mile and experience amazing art by renowned local, regional, and international artists. Discover delightful surprises, inspiration, festivities, and original works of art for purchase. Explore each distinctive gallery in-person or online all year long at your own pace.

Click here to learn more https://www.gallerywalkbloomington.com/
